page.title: 03The Venetian Fete
page.content:
{ The Venetian Fete}is held on the {Royal Military Canal}at Hythe every two years. It is like a carnival on water and instead of lorries decorated boats are used or sometimes boats tow a float.
The Mayor of Hythe and the Hythe Town Band sit on a platform which juts out into the water. The Mayor opens it with a speech and the band plays as the boats and floats travel past up the canal. On the opposite bank the public sit and watch. The procession goes up and down the canal in daylight and then up and down again torchlit in the dark.
After the procession is over there is a firework display and it all ends about ten o'clock or ten thirty.
